result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron Thomas Lafferty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Aaron Thomas Lafferty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Aaron Thomas Lafferty was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Aaron Thomas Lafferty was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Reckless Use of Firearm [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "G" Felony], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
-Court dismisses Counts 3 - 7.
-Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF244.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF244.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Aaron Thomas Lafferty appeared from jail. Case called at 11:02 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for sentencing. Court has a copy of the PSI. State has received a copy. No additions or corrections. ADA McKinley states victim is present in the courtroom and would like to make a statement today. Recites recommendations. Atty Andrea has a copy of PSI. No additions or corrections. Victim makes statement. Court notes did receive a number of letters from friends and family members. Copies have been provided to ADA McKinley and Atty Andrea. Atty Andrea gives sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Family member makes statement. 20 days to file appeal. Court orders:

Count 1:
Total 5 years sentence.
   - I/C 2 years, E/S 3 years. 283 days credit.
- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- AODA
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections
Count 2:
Total 5 years sentence.
   - I/C 2 years, E/S 3 years.  Concurrent to Ct. 1  
- Eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- AODA
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of CorrectionsConcurrent to Ct. 1
Letters from family members regarding sentencing hearing. hml
filed by Agent Joseph Starkey. eif
cc: Electronic to DOC, DA, Atty Andrea. hml
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
Sentencing hearing at 02-29-2016 11:00 am

CO: RMW, REP: Evenson, CLERK: Evenson. ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea DF: Aaron Thomas Lafferty appeared from jail. Case called at 10:00. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct. 1 removing the repeater and G to Ct 2 amending it to 941.20(2) in 15CF244. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 removing the repeater and guilty of Ct 2 amending to 941.20(2) in 15CF244. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 3, 4, 5, 6 and 7 in 15CF244. Atty's requests a PSI. Court orders a PSI to be completed by Feb. 19,2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Filed by ADA McKinley. Requesting a continuance of 11/30/2015 MH. km

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Aaron Thomas Lafferty appeared from jail. Case called at 2:29 p.m. Court notes received a copy of report from Dr. Minter. Atty Andrea also has a copy of the report. Requesting order appointing Dr. Harlan Hines for a second opinion. Court is not entitled to order a second evaluation. Defendant does not wish to have another evaluation. Atty Andrea will withdraw the NGI plea. Defendant is now requesting a speedy trial. Will waive the 4 days to accommodate schedules.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 10:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Atty Andrea has received a copy. Notes special appearance, waives further reading. May challenge some of the counts. Enter NG on all counts and not responsible due to NGI. Request court to appoint Dr. Harlan Hines for NGI evaluation. ADA McKinley requests Dr. Minter .Court will issue order for evaluation today. CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Aaron Thomas Lafferty appeared from jail. Case called at 9:32 a.m. Court reviews file. Competency evaluation was completed and received. Defendant is found competent to stand trial. State calls Deputy Michael O'Keefe to the stand. S/T Patrol Srgt. Michael O'Keefe employed with St Croix County. Direct by ADA McKinley. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Atty Andrea stipulates to the ID of the defendant. Court so notes. Cross by Atty Andrea. Witness excused. No other evidence by either party or witnesses. Court will find that probable cause on a felony is found and bind defendant over for trial. No request to modify bond. Bond continues.  Arraignment scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Examination of Def. Filed by Dr. Minter. km

RMW signed 6/9/15.  c: DA, Atty, SCSO & Wisc. Community Svcs. eif
Per RMW 6/9/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Status conference on June 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-No possession of firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Katherine B. or her residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Francis D. Collins & Ryan Mortel,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Aaron Thomas Lafferty appeared from jail. Defendant does qualify for PD.  Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Ryan Mortel requests $5000.00 CB w/AS, Atty Andrea does not argue. Defendant is on a PO hold. Atty Andrea raises competency issues and would like a doctor appointed. ADA Collins suggests a speedy prelim, Atty Andrea argues and would like an appointment.  Court orders Competency Evaluation for in-patient at the Jail.  Atty Andrea waives time limits and waives speedy prelim. Court finds probable cause a crime has been committed.  QUASH WARRANT.  Status conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
